channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senate report details 22 Americans caught in crosshairs of Trump's mass deportation sweep

item.title: The Danger of Weight-Loss Drugs Going Mainstream
item.description: GLP-1s could help turn around America’s obesity epidemic. They could also bring about a new era of eating disorders for young women.

item.title: The ‘Restrainers’ Get Their Consolation Prize
item.description: The administration’s National Security Strategy document would not create a safer world for Americans.

item.title: This New York Times Story Gets Everything Hilariously Wrong About Democrats And Immigration
item.description: Democrats did what they did with the border on purpose, and their only real regret, if they're honest, is that it was unpopular.

item.title: Illinois law protects immigrants from arrest near courthouses, hospitals or colleges

item.title: One Fire, One System: Hong Kong’s Fire Tragedy and the City That No Longer Exists
item.description: Hong Kong did not simply mishandle a tragedy; it demonstrated, once again, that it has become something fundamentally different from what it once was.

item.title: Yes, Revive the Monroe Doctrine
item.description: We should, by all means, breathe new life into a doctrine that in recent decades has become a museum curiosity.

item.title: Target Of Leftist Lawfare Seeks To Remove Judge For ‘Judicial Misconduct’
item.description: Jim Troupis, Wisconsin attorney for the Trump campaign following the rigged 2020 election, is fighting a politically-driven prosecution.

item.title: Trump Bails Out the Farmers He Kneecapped with Tariffs — Again
item.description: The president would rather pay farmers off with taxpayer funds than let them compete in a global marketplace.

item.title: Texas Rep. Marc Veasey leaving Congress to pursue Democratic bid for county judge seat
item.description: Texas Rep. Marc Veasey announced he's not seeking reelection, aiming instead for the Democratic nomination for Tarrant County judge.

item.title: Rep. Lauren Boebert used campaign funds to see Kid Rock, FEC filings show
item.description: Rep. Lauren Boebert spent thousands of dollars in campaign contributions to visit singer Kid Rock, who is rumored to be her boyfriend.
